intro: Hippagrostis hirtella, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruits are distinctive, pod-like structures that contain several seeds. Hippagrostis hirtella typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
